iBt4-JJup-rXNaGHhnZUzA.text: I've been going to Julio's since I was born. It's a family favorite. When Julio G's closed, I literally cried but Julio Too's keeps my cravings in line. The salsa is perfection. Hands down my favorite. The enchilada sauce I could drink. The mini chimis are addicting. I personally love their appetizer platter that has a little bit of everything because I can never decide on just one thing. The service is so genuine and kind. It's all around one of the best Mexican food restaurants in Scottsdale.

Dj4RCN9GF3nxjTUDpqSj3Q.text: Was great food and atmosphere. It's a small charming place. Looks a little old from the curb appeal but when u eat the food it's awesome. Got chips & salsa. The chips are thin and crisp. We ordered cheese enchiladas, corn tamale, bean burrito & bean tostado. They were pretty heavy handed on the chz on the enchiladas & tostadas. Good news if you like chz. I do but it was too over powering. The service was EXCELLENT. Happy cashier and there was someone in the seating area making sure the customers were good and the place was clean.

MSejWKc5NPNz0wE2DBjZxQ.text: I've eaten here a few times now since its close to my work, & have not been disappointed yet.  Today I got the pork green-chilli burrito served enchilada style, TOTAL MOUTHGASM!

QpnVJKJgtYu1T6erV5gsFw.text: Short and sweet....  -Close to work -Lunch Specials -Pollo Magnifico -Mini Chimis w. jalapeno cream cheese  The end!  :D

AxfmAaG-sTJYsoglAHIfuA.text: I was mildly okay with Julios because it was cheap and it never made extravagant claims to being very good.  It's greasy, overly-cheesed "Mexican" food that's bad for you.  Sometimes that's what you want... the large, lousy portions for not much money with shredded bits of iceberg lettuce.  Make no mistake, it's not good, but sometimes we all have our guilty pleasures and sub-adequate Mexican food happens to be one of mine sometimes--usually when I'm hungover or something.  Last time I went there, I popped open a little salsa container for the chips and, Jesus Christ, it was a solidified gelatinous cube.  It wasn't frozen, either.  It was gelatin.  It was this... ugh.  It was denser than Jell-O, too, you could slice it with a plastic knife and it would continue standing on its own.  And that's when I realized that what I was eating wasn't just bad food that's fun to treat yourself too every couple of months or a few times a year, I was eating a pile of failure.  The novelty was gone.  It's all fun and games until you see that salsa.  It's like having fun drinking in a dirty dive bar, then you fall down on a pile of broken glass.  The fun's over... clean up the glass, guys.  Start making fucking salsa in a food processor and take some goddamn pride in what you do.

POlMEJdWp1PpG371B_e-YQ.text: Juilo's is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale. Does not have the best or largest dining area but we can usually find a place outside on the patio. Food is always delicious and portions are large and plentiful especially for the price. I would highly recommend for anyone looking for some good cheap Mexican.

uUoPQeN_qI-l4adHnrar3w.text: Been coming here for years. The staff is friendly and the food is always fresh and tasty as hell. Awesome Mexican food, and great location; it's close to everything in Old Town.

ZYKTJfu_cy0QMq_3LP4p6Q.text: They are always tip notch. Great food and awesome service! They go above and beyond always with bringing food to your table, giving extra chips and salsa when you need. I love the pollo magnefico! It's amazing! Chicken chimichanga with jalapeno cream cheese and shredded cheese on top. Also love that they have orange blossom beer. Come here! You won't regret it.

o-6ESipd2oqfgosLq2n8AA.text: I like that for a lunch special margarita, I got the extra "boost" I needed at the careful curation and handling of Julio's Too Employee Who Looks Like a Phoenix Musician But I'm Not Sure Which Band; however, I lost my head high about this place knowing that if you call in to order beforehand, you may just be placed on hold indefinitely by said Julio's Too Band Employee Dude. Anyway, food was cheap, margs were real, and I probably smell like enchilada sauce, but I Don't Care. The neon lights in the interior decor had me befuddled. Order the cheese enchis if you decide to go here despite my review.

JuYAjmEtzl7ziPyKvWaHkQ.text: We love Julios !!!!!! We are never disappointed with takeout. Always delivers as the best Mexican restaurant  in town!!!

e_PrHLtbaFbU_P6QNEQ11w.text: I had the Lunch Pollo Magnifico, yummy as always! Nice and crispy tortilla with delicious jalapeno cream cheese. The absolute best hot sauce and guacamole with the chips. This is a huge portion so I'm lucky enough to have it again today!

BbYng7rvmg2tWzYviCP7aA.text: Everything else in Scottsdale is kinda douchey...this place is great! Good food, good beer, affordable, and most importantly...character.

n-XQ0ahz25Xp9mc9kwZe1g.text: Good Fresh authentic Mexican food....good prices, Great service....first time here and I will be coming back for sure.....and you get free fresh Chips with every order!!!! Great customer service also!!!

BGjWK-q4WYTcn3GvrPlJEg.text: I love Julios too!!!!!! The best mexican food around. Free chips and salsa and the Chicken Mini Chimis are to die for. Definitely a must if you haven't tried it.  P.s. writing a bad review about the restaurant for being a dumbass and parking in the parking lot to go out clubbing, resulting in getting towed, isn't the restaurants fault. Follow the parking rules!!

FprXHTw14VETXeCVwlOXew.text: Julios has the best Mexican food for its price. Great location in camelback. Always friendly workers. Their chunky salsa is out of this world! And they have a punch card to get a free meal (after 10 lunches or something). So sad to see other Julio locations close, I hope this one stays open. If you like traditional Mexican food (and they do serve beer as well)  you should definitely check out julios

iQLDZ1UnHx_Zu2dMIrXm7A.text: This place kills it the service is dope. The food is exactly what you when you're out looking for that drunchies fix or when just plan hungry.

SKIsNPLMkCvudFIQjDLRbg.text: I eat here every weekend, I work right across  the street and go in about 15 or 20 minutes before they close. They are always nice to me and thank me for coming in. Much appreciated

TJ0n8jINp0cYa7uOsR5GNg.text: This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant.  The cheese enchiladas are better than anywhere in the valley. Chinos, tacos and many good choices!

O-r_ibsPVqQsq1M3F3JyMg.text: I've been an on and off patron of this establishment for a few years now. It became a family tradition to order take-out for get togethers.  Never eaten at this location, just take-out. I usually stuck with a beef chimi and was pretty satisfied. It comes with rice and beans, plus you get the chips and salsa, so I feel that the price is a fairly decent value.  This past week we went on a Julio's kick so I tried something new. First, the green chili pork chimi. Yum! Instantly replaced the beef in my mind.  Tonight, I tried the pollo magnifico.... Wow. How did I never look at this section on the menu? Loved it. Basically a fundido chimi, lives up to its name! Also, the nachos supreme were quite yummy but got pretty soggy in the take-out container.

bynn6lpdsxWgxm0p3Si2dw.text: I've been looking for a casual, but quality Mexican food restaurant to order takeout from that is as good as the Carambas I used to live by. And I think I found it!  The other night, we ordered dinner to go from here and I was pleasantly surprised.  The Mini Chimis with Jalapeno cream cheese were just what I was hoping for.  Can't wait to try more things here!

aroCwmwPnfOrHcVdsiKvqg.text: This place is great, it always has been!!!  I am going to start with service, It could not have been any better for the environment, fast friendly, accommodating, and just kind. Not gushy or desperate, just all around good especially from the cashier, who might be the manager or owner, and the guy with the FREE CHIPS and Salsa. "if you would like more of either, just let me know" Wow that alone makes me want to come back.  My lunch was exceptional, with 2 big stuffed shredded beef tacos with rice and beans with a Pepsi for less then 10 bucks. The tacos were as good as I remember and the rice and beans were just the right size, along with some shredded lettuce and diced tomatoes.   The place itself was welcoming for me because every detail in the lobby was perfect from beer cooler to counters, the floors were spotless and the beverage station was well stocked and gleaming.  If you are wondering if this should be on your list, I say YES. its casual and you order at the counter but there is beer and Margaritas so enjoy a little casual done right!

GZCQYC2EPU4gK0Op1b6Dtw.text: This place has AMAZING portions and seriously puts East Coast Mexican food to shame. Has a decent amount of vegetarian options as well. Would definitely come back if I'm ever in Arizona again.

8XjSvRNh9cF-ULaTEG7cvw.text: Great food!! Will definitely be going again and again! My mom said it was the best Mexican food she's ever had and that says a lot given she's a world traveler from San Francisco. She had the seafood enchilada I had the chicken spinach enchilada and we shard the sinful spinach quest dip. Yummy yummy!!!

jIbVbQraIO-Lv1pjJBDYdA.text: The food here is amazing but the service is lacking. Every time I place a lunch order to go, I have to wait beyond the quoted time. I usually am quoted 30-45 minutes from the time I call. I never arrive before the quoted time and still have to wait. I've had to wait 25 minutes past the quoted time totaling an hour from the time I placed my call. When it was brought to the employees attention, he apologized and called over a woman with blonde hair. She forced an apology that was completely insincere. She said they get orders called in starting at 9am which I'm not really sure how that affects my call. She obviously knows what orders are ahead of my call. To top it off, when I got back to the office, I realized they forgot a bag of chips.

ELiQdDTz9mDvmrkjXORc7w.text: What a deal! Where else can you get a burrito the size of your head and a Margarita for $10!!

O3MzpaxaYJDUqhAQ6MUS4w.text: Wow! This place was great! I had 2 carne asada tacos. Plenty of food. I audio had chips and salsa. Couldn't finish it all. .....but it was hard to stop. I would definitely come back when I'm in town. The people working they day were super nice too! Nice to sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side of building with name

U9CcNVxLePPntw-TSBKAew.text: This is an excellent "hole-in-the-wall, locals" Mexican restaurant.  Food and service all outstanding -- if we ever return to Scottsdale, this is where we'll go for good Mexican food.

_R_zSD7pmknz1ztysuMOUg.text: Found this place near Old Town!  Great food and service.  Will be back!  Had their enchiladas and tallas plate.  Not being from the area they gave good suggestions

YfSDrL6rAwhcix4mMpZ6ng.text: Good food. Reasonable prices . Service was surprisingly speedy for a weekday lunch hour.

081zkcepVNpb5P7THI62Zg.text: Not sure if this place is a hidden little secret- but it feels like one! With so many new restaurants popping up, don't overlook Julio's Too. It's tried and True authentic Mexican food. No frills just good quality food. I recommend that chicken taco bowls!

SPYLY5REDjF0sVaZWz4jWA.text: Best chicken tacos I've ever had! I have craving for them!!! I've been coming here forever and it's one of my favorite places to eat ever! So many good things to say about this place! Can't say enough.

quLTUodYanMS1VeT779yQA.text: This place is legit for a few reasons - their food is authentic and the service is always friendly and quick.  If you dine in their happy hour deal on margaritas is pretty good too!  Great salsa and all of their offerings are fresh and tasty.  There aren't a ton of great Mexican joints near old town but I think this is one of the better options so I'll probably visit every other month or so.  More often than not we get take out and they haven't ever gotten the order wrong which is a plus!

8cohqmu8JBHuH8nqWhxslQ.text: YUMMMMM!   Very convenient little place. The food isn't like gourmet best Mexican food but it's still really good. I love the chicken flautas and chips and salsa. The rice and beans suck but who cares.

7gx73pBSOE8f8TL8N_i_Rg.text: This is an amazing little place off is Scottsdale Road. Parking lot can be hard to navigate and you may have trouble finding a space. Parking on the street is usually easier. The staff is always friendly. Food is delicious. I often order the mini chimi, chicken enchiladas, spinach enchiladas or beef tacos. Salsa is very good!

A5cg4dlZ8LLYKHLIfiMM-g.text: I have been going to Julio's too for about 6 years. It is one of my favorite places in the valley to get Mexican food, especially if your just looking for something quick or something to take home with you! I have never tried anything that was not good. Some of my favorites are the tacos, red chili burro and the mini chimi's with jalapeno cream cheese! I also love that they have Mexican sodas in the fridge. Nothing like a Mexican coke to go with your meal!

o_Byx_c_YMWjzl8ySbrllQ.text: Came here as some friends wanted to bring me here as I've never been before.   The staff was very nice and were always there if you needed them. They have a wide variety of food to chose from which is great! The chips and salsa are good as well as their guacamole is outta this world.   The quality and quantity of food was excellent! I'll be visiting here more!

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IaFEIX9wS9KmYxKyyyUqgQ.text: This is definitely a nice hidden gem in the Old Town Scottsdale area. They have awesome Mexican food here and relatively inexpensive as well. So far I have ordered the enchiladas and tacos here and thought they were great. The chicken enchilada was one of the best that I've had so far. The ordering process is simple and I liked the casual atmosphere. I have gone back a few times and had a great experience each time.

zS4S9PO_ioW_g1P4IW4eAA.text: My favorite Mexican Food in the area. Great staff, fresh food and unlimited chips & salsa. A staple in our family! Hard to go wrong here

XSMAzLhZwMcYsBa7XMi-fw.text: Been coming here for lunch with business associates for a number of years.  The staff is always friendly and courteous.  The prices are very reasonable with nice sized portions.  I usually get a two item combo for lunch and it's plenty of food.  It's not fast food, but your order comes out pretty quickly.  The food is authentic Mexican and I think it's a really good meal.

C0BEAGVpTo0Xy38A4hXrhQ.text: Surprised at 4 star rating. The place is constantly busy. Good food, free chips and salsa. What's not to love?

9zPeX_xU5D5sQ_Sl4WDLng.text: Must visit when in Scottsdale! Sit outside and enjoy the patio and chips and salsa. Have the Carne Asada burrito, you won't regret it!

MWA-fHZ7EjWL4HNmRrkeew.text: I am not a huge fan of Mexican food because I have dietary restrictions. However Julio's too has amazing food! The staff is so kind and very accompanying to my special orders. The food is always perfect, and I definitely think it is worth every penny!!

xRJhB4c0znKGUkv_CDA2bg.text: Best place in Scottsdale to get casual Mexican food.  Our favorite Mexican take-out place by far, but dining in is nice too, very friendly staff and they have margaritas!   It's counter service, so be prepared to stand in line...it can get crowded, but it's worth it.

apDFMCag7W-qzDcbO_g7RA.text: Solid take out option in old town.   Salsa is great and the chips are really nice.  I generally do not go in for the hard shell tacos but at this joint it is worth the extra calories.  If planning to host a game or a party, this is a good option.   The open at 11 so games that start on Sundays have a disconnect with timing food and football.

lK8tIOuXtmFnm7kITcXC6A.text: You will never be disappointed here . It's got what you want the tacos are killer , rellenos classic , can't say enough . Try it you will be hooked . Parking is kind of pain sometimes

0IdDmjl6Cb8znYqeKvku0A.text: Tried this place for the first time today and was not disappointed. Got a lunch special and it was huge for the price, more than fair portions and prices! I ordered it in and the phone service was good so I imagine the staff being great. The enchilada style burrito was so good, I'm coming back for more!

v_ZmRp270lGe-l8feXRIUA.text: We self catered for around 40 people with a couple days notice and it was so good! All of our guests raves about the food. Highly recommend spinach enchiladas and chili rellanos.

d19ftRH_ciehfu6U410eFw.text: First time here! To-go on a Sunday so I expected it wouldn't be quick and it wasn't. The food was excellent and that is what matters MOST for me. I have been searching for the chimi app that came with the cream cheese for a while. I wasn't disappointed! They were crispy and cooked perfect.  The jalapeno cream cheese was what I was craving.  Since it was my first time, thought I'd play it safe with enchiladas. I ordered the 2 items with rice n beans. I chose the chicken enchi and beef enchi. I was impressed!  The sauce was what I was hoping for. I'm glad I found this place. I don't see myself eating here in the heat of Summer but I can definitely see myself getting it to-go. I will definitely be back!

ChwgCdeGLgU47PHWX2KgIg.text: We love this cute little restaurant! Delicious and affordable Mexican food with plenty of options. They have all the deliciously fried and cheesy traditional Mexican fare and some tasty salads for when I want a healthier meal. The employees are also extremely accommodating and polite!

q-KifyLggBd6EGJ3djFnIQ.text: Love this place. Chicken Chimi is my go to!! Can't beat the margarita price! Only downside is that the parking lot is tiny.

0ZneZdFQ33O3FLn_OEAsyg.text: This place is amazing! There is not one item that I did not like.  We can here with the entire family. They set us up outside and constantly checked on us to make sure we were taken care of. Everyone was extremely nice and courteous.  If you are in the area try this place out. You will not be disappointed.

07gZxBJYh3FMy1zs_IIwaA.text: Amazing food and very generous portions. We were referred by the man working the desk at our hotel and he did not lead us astray. Incredible authentic experience in the heart of Scottsdale. Love it.

pmY18fbCOAxCAgB6TWdLKw.text: This place has not been busy at all for quite some time. Cooks are not consistent. Not the Julio's 2 it used to be. Better to stay at the W or Scottsdale road.

NpnrQb0RbytgGREyB9A2gA.text: We love this place.  Its our families go to for quick, good, Mexican food.  Prices are fair as well.

Lk5tQihfoFRobYf0rbLs1Q.text: One of the best places to eat if you like Mexican. Food. Delicious free chips and salsa. My favorite is the jalapeno cream cheese chicken chimmy conga and the cheese enchiladas are just the best

Zx02VHN0uMJTm_Jw8WWHqQ.text: We wanted to try local place and Mexican was on our mind. Based on Yelp reviews we decided to give this restaurant a try. There was simply no parking space so we thought the food might be really good. We parked almost a block away and walked in hot sun to enjoy the lunch. The guy at the counter was really not much into taking our order and finally got my husband's order wrong but charged the bill correctly so we don't know if the cook or the server messed up. Thankfully cousin and I got our orders correctly. The service wasn't all that good. The food strictly tasted okay. I have better Mexican food around.

Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tacos

d338L3mLffs4tucf4V_cFw.text: Do yourself a favor and get the Carne Asada dinner plate ($9). Here is what it includes: -two carne Asada tacos the size of Texas -a huge plate of beans and rice that could feed a family -fresh tortilla chips with salsa fo freeee -guac (not extra like chipotle!) and sour cream *also they have $2 Margs if you want to turn up. The fajitas and chimichanga are also bomb.com. My dad actually was like why did u spend so much money on food and was shocked two entres cost less than $20. Gotta love AZ food prices

I6VEbCEU5s_XeaAoMAHtwQ.text: I have been here a few times. The food is good for a cheap Mexican restaurant (you get what you pay for). I would highly recommend calling ahead of time to place your order or  you will wait forever. The staff is always friendly. Overall not a bad place to eat.

3CACv2jYL_WjvfFCFj594Q.text: Pretty good Mexican food. It's nice that they provide free chips & salsa before your meal, even though it's a casual counter service taco shop. Spinach enchilada makes a nice vegetarian choice. Generous portions & affordable prices. Friendly, prompt service. Fine, fine place to grab a quick bite but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

iYLCahbd1i9hnaH9mc9agg.text: Two words: Fat Mac. I get why Mac was eating Chimichangas so much. Before coming to Julio's I never had Chimichangas, and wow, I totes get why Mac had them all the time. They are delicious, along with every single thing on the Julio's menu.  The people there are the polite incarnate. They would probably have a funeral for a bird or something. Probably one they don't even know like a raven, or even a pigeon - the rats of the sky. More importantly, whenever I go to have Julio's I have such a good time with their food. The first time I went with a real homie and I got the "Pollo Magnifico." Good doesn't quite capture it. My heart skipped so many beats I developed a heart murmur.   It has a bit of a retro vibe too. It's like if Pulp Fiction was shot within a Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale flair. Except for the busier times, say the weekends, you can always get a seat and your food quite fast.   Every other time after that was a bad experience, not because of Julio's, they were always perfect, but because I tried to introduce possible love interests to this place. I guess there were other things going on that made those relationships not work, but the fait accompli in my mind was that they didn't like Julio's. I mean just because we had dinner somewhere else before why can't you get another snack? You gotta always have room for Julio's.  Through breakups, the woes of relationships, and the bliss of love, Julio's is gonna have your back and always be delish. Stay up fam. Get in there and get a Chimichanga.

2J8_W5N5cgO9BOjB55KqCw.text: Gross. The spanish rice is gross - bland with what appears to be canned mixed vegetables in it. The ground beef in their beef taco salad is like finally ground cat meat = low quality.   Just low quality food that most white people, who are none the wiser as to what comprises good Mexican/Tex Mex food,  will eat.   Today I found bug legs in my salad lettuce...later after I had left the restaurant and was munching on leftovers.   Prices are reasonable and food is served quickly. The tall dark stocky dude that is always in there when I come in on weekdays during is not personable and kind of a an ass.

8XFB43I6--3TQAoFAjhpxw.text: Horrible. The only reason for two stars is because the staff is nice and the food did not make me throw up (yet). Bland glop. Poor quality food. Sugary tomato sauce on the enchilada. Bland glop is the best I can say. Hubs had pork that was fatty and bland. I had enchilada that was weirdly sweet and gloppy and bland. Gross. Never again.

thwYqtVXe4JreHjTX092RQ.text: A disappointment. Pollo magnifico was tasty although a bit weird and with massive amounts of jalapeno sour cream. Carne asada tacos were tough and without good flavor. Sopapilla was bizarre, more like a deep fried pancake. On the plus side, it was clean, cheap, fast, with good service. But that didn't make up for the food. We won't be back.

Vm2sJiUtBGKlXxFVNVwxLg.text: Only tried on beef taco, but not too great. The shredded beef didn't seem shredded, it seems more mushy and chopped. The taco shell was crispy, but outlandishly greasy at the bottom, which is typical, but this was too much grease. The taco was big and worth the $2.55, but the chicken option sadly is dark meat. The free chips and salsa (mild) were probably the best part of the this snack. Salsa was in small cups, but fresh and chips were hot and tasty. Big negative is not having horchata, even the counter girl questioned the manager on this big oversight. Decent lunch special - will give the place one more try for the tamale in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef taco

w3S7d8L9oOJxiZLz_gkiWA.text: Highly recommend the sinful Pollo Magnifico. Great portion size, terrific flavor and fair cost. Anything at Julio's Too is going to be top notch so you really can't go wrong. Favorite Mexican eatery I've had in my 5+ years living in AZ.

anfXpzK1x8tA-0M82qE6EQ.text: The best. Grew up on Julios. My friends use this restaurant to get me out of my house when I don't want to go out

zyr0IQSx7yzTOK4FKugL7A.text: Best shredded beef tacos in all of Scottsdale/ Phoenix!!! Thank you so much for having them. Being from Los Angeles I was so excited that an amazing tacos place was down the street from our favorite hotel in n old town Scottsdale! Also the chips are so thin and crispy, definitely very fresh. Everyone working looks super happy, so you know the service us gonna be good if the staff is happy! Thanks again, we'll definitely be back!

1BSXJqxQ48ItLpSi5LoVtA.text: My new all time favorite go-to Mexican food restaurant. This place is amazing, authentic and delicious, I have been raving about it to my friends constantly. You get exactly what you pay for and more. The prices are outstanding and they even throw in complimentary guac and chips & salsa (which is awesome)! I recommend this place to everyone.

AHU7M6N7dGe6VjF3I4AkZw.text: The food was great. The staff was happy and gracious. Out of all the places I ate in my trip to AZ this was in the top ten. Simple good food.

KxvN-P7KFZG5Sb2irkSPtA.text: It looks like a "where the locals go" kind of place, which I love when visiting a new town. And it must be because While we waited for our order, the staff new several customers who came in- repeat customers, that's a good sign right?! We weren't disappointed, we had a large order and everything was Very tasty! We would definitely go back..

ES4Gq3119hiFFfR6AoiUuQ.text: This place was right across the street from the hotel I was staying at and boy am I happy I stopped in! I had the beef tacos, rice and beans which was delicious! The free chips and salsa was a surprise too. The staff was friendly and speedy, I will definitely be back.

adKUI5cE0egzYo9JenQbZQ.text: I always get the Pollo Magnifico and it never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel welcome. The only issue is the parking. I drove around for 10 minutes today looking for a spot, but the food is definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pollo Magnifico with chips and salsa

SSFcSbyELumJ7MfnUPgjrQ.text: When I entered this place I was confused if they were open or not. I had to walk around to find a server. I only stayed because I was meeting friends for brunch. The server was nice but messed up everyone's order.  I won't even get started on the disappointment in the food.

km2-cbFWRQuuq0hQtrDoGw.text: I was bummed when they closed the original Julio's on Indian School. Anyway, I finally went in here recently to discover it's not just take out - they actually have tables and lower prices - awesome Mexican food!

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HP56-qJTprGym3jL6GdMuA.text: Really nice staff, totally impressed by the young gentleman who too our order. This is a regular spot for one of my good friends, I see why, great staff and good food is a great combination.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6KmiFj1m6WYhPPaB0uW5LQ.text: Lately they have really been falling apart. My office is around the corner, so I used to order from Julio's once a week. The food was always tasty and fresh. But now there is a new manager, he is rude, never smiles, never looks you in the eye and the food has really gone down hill. My last lunch actually gave me the runs. Too bad, now I have to find another place for my Mexican lunches.

o8gJ4kjk-O76qI5P_CAKLQ.text: I ask what there isn't to like about this particular Julio's Too? For my entire adolescence I searched and searched for a tex-mex style restaurant in my hometown area... but alas found nothing. It wasn't until aught nine that I discovered this magnificent shrine to tasteful eats.   Family owned and operated, Julio's provides a warm and friendly environment for the casual diner. The menu is simple yet diverse with plate combinations and creations that are not so easy to find in the sonoran style valley. Looking for  recommendation? Try the Green Chile Relleno plate with a side of love from full timer Steve Rosa. Want  a burrito, well they come in size BIG at Julio's and full of all kinds of fresh ingredients. Need I mention how delicious the FREE chips and salsa are with every meal purchased? And with a handful of good friends the restaurant can quickly turn into a wonderfully amusing adventure into the land great food. All in all, I highly recommend stopping by and not just getting a meal, but maybe making a friend or two at the four stool bar section... I know I have!  xo, Josie

ViY7YsMsktFsMZwgE2CrEA.text: Best Mexican food in the country. You can bet they are cookin up some of the best green corn tamales a mouth can taste. There's nothing like the pollo magnifico, it's the best plate around. If you think you've had good food before... Think again. The mini chimi's are incredible.   The staff is so good to their customers. Go in and just have a conversation with them. You'll see. They love their customers. Steve, the owners son is a total hottie. Have some free chips and salsa. I can sit there and eat them all day.   Seriously go here if you're looking for good mex food. Prices are amazing and so is the food. I've never had anything I didn't like from their menu, and I've tried so many different things.

h2AF2k8vLP59JB4gxRimbA.text: The big Julio's is closed and transformed into a breakfast place but I am so happy that Julio's Too has survived. Good, cheap, Mexican food. Two people could easily split a combo for a super-cheap lunch. Their take out is fast or there is a small seating area inside the restaurant. Or, to pick up dinner on the way home you can call ahead and have it waiting for you. I love that they serve beer bottles to go!

i6hdP8FLaM0ZoptB1H4gTQ.text: For quick service and always satisfying my taste for lazy comfort food, this place rocks. Do not come here for great service or ambiance, its a take-out place more than anything else.  I've tried several of their dishes but always resort back to my classic/no-frills order: two chicken tacos. These fill me up and have a respectable amount of chicken in them. The fried taco shells and shredded cheese is what I'm really craving but since the chicken actually provides nutrition it's a nice balance.  I don't care for the albonginas soup - too oily. They do a very good job of keeping the salads healthy as long as you don't eat the shell it's a good healthy meal. The nachos are. .... nachos. Order those for your drunk friends. Back to my point - in my experience stick with the tacos if that's what you're in the mood for. I'll choose these tacos over Best Little Taco shop or Blind Pig any day. Ole!

5H_LwJSatRPMUOk70VBfbQ.text: I think I am overdue for a review. I have been coming here for about two years now. Sometimes I walk here because parking is limited! But, worth it if you have to walk! Always have had fast service and great customer service. Love dining in (have a huge selection of Mexican beers, not just corona- sol, Victoria, modelo! My favs!) or taking out! Anytime I need a app for a work function I always call in ahead and pick up. Always bring people from out of town here too and they love it! Def worth checking out! And get the mini chimis!

Cwko70u8ox-IGp4M-rqKTA.text: I love everything I've ever ordered here! I particularly love just grabbing any of the Big Burritos when I'm indecisive or ordering the Mini Chimichanga's whenever I bring someone new here -- that jalapeno cream cheese is pretty unique and delicious! Great lunch specials and if you eat in you always get free chips and salsa. Super friendly staff. Would recommend to anyone looking for a quick, big, decently priced lunch or dinner in a homey little restaurant with great service.

OuZ61xO8KqKCc4d0j0YkJQ.text: Fantastic take out Mexican food!   Whenever we want quick and quality take out Mexican food we come here. They have delicious food, friendly service, reasonable prices, and healthy portion sizes.   Everything on the menu is good, but my favorites are the mini chimis (cream cheese sauce is amazing), pork green chili, shredded beef tacos, flautas, and their chimichangas (oh...they are giant and glorious)!  They also have old fashioned sodas, beer, and margaritas to go along with your chips and salsa. Their salsas are excellent, and if you mix the hot with the mild the blend is magical. My only knock on them is that their chips are mediocre at best. Normally I judge a place based on their chips, but in this case the rest of the food makes up for the lack of chip flavor.  If you are in old town Scottsdale with a yen for mex or if you just want a quick take out check it Julios Too!

Ck2QldBR3L7u8OdikxxTFg.text: Some of the best damn chimichangas this side of the border! Been going here and Julio's Too (RIP) for years, and the quality and flavor has never let me down. This place is a hidden gem in the middle of old town debauchery. Seriously, if you're hungry and on that block, this is where you need to go.

z5-vCqFdJ1ukj_xbhBMhfw.text: Fun place in Old Town to grab some delicious Mexican food. We enjoyed the Vegetarian burrito enchilada style. The array of different spicy sauces they offer are a fun little treat. Inexpensive margaritas (if you like that kinda thing) We enjoyed a mmm root beer. Staff was fast and efficient... keep up the good work guys.

smrq7pqRBNclTqKBI5mA3Q.text: Mediocre.  We went there because of all the reviews, but I guess it's all rich people who can't stand flavor.  Salsa and Guacamole were good and margaritas were cheap, but the mix wasn't great and the food was meh.  No returning for me.

Am3Xwr_fpZQFFNCYvfSD1Q.text: Great service and food. I ordered the chicken taco and chicken enchilada combo. It comes with rice and beans as well. The portions are generous and they also give you an order of chips. The hot salsa was flavorful. I was disappointed that they don't serve horchata or jamaica here hehe. If I'm in the area again, I'll definitely come back.

e7099AdBkv_-GAQT8o3grg.text: I really enjoyed coming here for lunch the other day and plan on making Julio's Too my go to place for Mexican food in Scottsdale.  They have a large menu with all the classics and their prices are very reasonable.  Best of all, the meals come with free unlimited delicious chips and salsa.  I had a chicken burrito enchilada style for lunch.  It was $7.50 and came with rice and beans.  It was delicious and very filling.    I noticed that some people got their food in a to go container even though they were eating in the restaurant.  I think this is a great idea so that you don't have to eat it all at once and can just pop the lid on the container and leave when you're done.  They also have a decent craft beer selection and not just Corona, Modelo, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burrito enchilada style

Yh-eqOAX9C_pS9yARcrvBg.text: Alllllways a good place for gringo Mexican food.   $2.50 margs combined with cheese enchiladas and crispy shredded beef tacos!  Perfect combo for a Saturday.

7HbTAMkifa0e16sIrUumBw.text: The location is great! The food was tasty but nothing special, pretty typical Mexican food you could find anywhere. Salsa was great and the diner-like theme was fun!

9it7Nhw49ZA8qdGO4GwjpQ.text: For local fast food style Mexican, Julio's is not bad. The chips and salsa were fresh, but a bit greasy. The fajita salad was good, with decent chicken, and a fried tortilla bowl. The tamale was huge, not the best I've had, but definitely edible. However the flan was horrible - very hard and spongey, but I wasn't expecting too much from fast food. I mean, it's certainly not healthy or authentic Mexican but it's a step up from Taco Bell.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tamale with some kind of gravy
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fajita salad bowl

2hXp_-6flOZuki4-3qXk5Q.text: Went to this place today for lunch and had the lunch special (D), Pollo Magnifico.  The plate comes with rice and beans as sides, and the entree is a deep fried chicken burrito with a jalapeno cream cheese, and cheese topping.  I really enjoyed the Pollo Magnifico, but the rice was slightly over cooked and a little mushy, and the beans were over cooked and dry. You get free chips and salsa with your meal. The chips were fresh and the salsa was good. The place has a typical taco stand, cheesy atmosphere, but the service was friendly. Overall I would say this place deserves 3.5 stars, but that's not an option, so I will be kind and give it 4 stars.

QQS0s8-ePKzSouYdD9JDvA.text: Solid Tex mex food!   Not fancy but it's very tasty!   Affordable too and they have beer!

FVoHynB4oAzRIr-keIErCQ.text: If you're looking above par, fast Mexican food, then this is your place! I recommend the mini chimis with the jalapeno cream cheese dip. I think the cream cheese dulls the spiciness because I don't like spicy things and I love it!

Y1-FpTxlCsmAg62DCj_1Aw.text: I wish they delivered. Love the food. Julio's please Create a separate area for pick up phone orders.

MboLb9HjamSVJduQlULv6g.text: Julio's is my go to place for Mexican when I'm Scottsdale. I've never had any issues but the past 2 times I've called in an order and told the time it would be ready it's been a horrible experience. The 1st we had to wait at least 30 minutes past the pick up time and was late getting back to work. Today we waited at least 15 minutes past the pick up time. When speaking to the staff we were degraded and told to call earlier next time. Thing is we did!! Our pick up time was WAY before any lunch rush. The staff didn't seem to give a $&/! that we waited for our food long after it was due. We don't think it was even started until after we showed up. Even tho their food is excellent, I'm not sure if I will come back.

WBovIfgeF5SFKkxyxyQvpA.text: This is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona. The food is so authentic and flavorful, it can't be beat! I always order the polo magnifico  so juicy, flavorful, creamy, and full of love. Plus the beans and rice are to die for!   Another great option is the spinach cheese carne asada burrito, carne asada fries, chimichangas, enchiladas and of course burritos enchilada style! Love their salsas and cream cheese sauce is so delicious. I wish they had more and need to reopen the one on Val Vista! LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH.  Also have a great selection of beer (:

GHOMYN_rBfxwnuZf-94dlQ.text: So I've driven by this place for years and finally stopped in. I got the green corn tamale and cheese enchilada combo plate with rice and bean and it was Too good! They also have free chips and salsa and the $2.50 margarita was on point for the price. Definitely not luxurious inside, but it was comfortable and busy! I'll be back to Julio's Too...but wondering where Julio's Juan is?

aZUIuleLuE5FTAsBbiQCUQ.text: Fish tacos were awesome and authentic. Cool spot to grab a quick bite. All ingredients were fresh and at a great price

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interesting little place with walk up ordering and quick service.
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos are awesome and very authentic! All ingredients tasted very fresh

Od4Vu75bL1GRl_SilbIZEQ.text: Been coming here for years. Please know the Julio's on Tatum isn't owned by the same wonderful people as the one on camelback. There a difference in food and service. Don't waste time in going to the one on Tatum. We eat at least 2-3 times a week when we're in Arizona. Best Mexican food around!!! Great staff and wonderful owners!!

AAl7NhysaZN__MDpA8_MpQ.text: My wife and I were staying at the W Hotel next door and this little place was by far the cheapest place to eat and the best all in one! The first thing was the excellent beer selection right when you walk in! We stayed in Scottsdale for 3 days and ate there 3 days! We just flew in from Texas to see a KISS concert, so we know Mexican food. We weren't expecting much, so the first day we just got a beer and a coke and they gave us free chips and salsa! We were amazed by the huge menu so the next day we got dinners and the food was pretty spectacular for under $20! I had the pork chili and my wife had spinach enchiladas. On our third day I had the chili relleno lunch and my wife had the taco salad. We shared a margarita and still got 2 drinks for under $20! Awesome. And then there's the service. The guys at the counter noticed I was wearing a bacon shirt and we discussed bacon for a minute. The second day we showed up, I was in a different bacon shirt and we talked bacon some more! On the third day they were still amazed I had yet another bacon shirt (I have a LOT of bacon shirts). They were great to have lunch and dinner with! I really liked the salsa too. In Texas your salsa is always tomato, jalapeno, onion, and cilantro, but here they got the heat up with some other chiles and seasoning that made it special and good, though what they call hot was still pretty mild for us. Love, Aaron The Bacon Nation baconnation.net

v5cgHeXv4pajVSrmz3ilvQ.text: How is it that I am the first to review this place? It is a classic, and it is always busy! Go figure?   Julio's Too is the take-out version of it's big brother Julio G's, the menus are the same but the prices are sure not! Julio's Too is very reasonably priced, and offers the same quality of food as the main restaurant. The lunch specials are amazing, with most being around just $6.00!! They too have my beloved Jalapeno Cream Cheese, and I usually end up ordering a half-pint to take home with me.   I love the flautas, green chile burritos, shredded beef tacos and the mini chimis. Their salsa is very addicting, I just wish that they gave you more with your take-out order. The only flaw I find with Julio's Too is the beans. I am a bean connoisseur, and their beans just do not quite stack up to the others out there. They are just lacking that special something. When I have a craving for Mexican food, I usually lean towards Julio's because it is close to home, fast and cheap, but sometimes when I am really in the mood for some good beans, I have to go somewhere else with better beans!   But even with the questionable beans, I am still there quite frequently.

oU94HswU8sVuetjdkhKtyA.text: I have been here many times but last few trips I ordered a burro..it was filled with mostly rice and beans and very little meat. Very disappointed and will not go back.

gk9gdUcFXdlpWfwHFT1p8w.text: I've been to the majority of the big name taco shops in the valley  and man this place kills them all. Everything is very fresh, taco shells are magnificent, chips and salsa were perfect, and it's a very friendly place.   They have a frozen take home selection which I think I'll take advantage of next time, because those frozen tamales were massive and looked delicious.   I recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick lunch or just craving for a quick Mexican fix, it's amazing!

-2WNaqKZKgOoGC9qLW1DoA.text: mmmmmm, I love Julio's Too. Sometimes just the a la carte dishes are plenty for lunch, but the lunch and dinner specials are a great price and oh, so good.

ASwD_vrmcC4SJeJPM8ZI3w.text: I used to have this anorexic friend.  She would join us girls for dinner sometimes.  She would never order anything of course, and when the food would come she would squirm in her seat, roll her eyes and say, "Are you seriously going to eat that?". When I took the lid off my Julio's Too take out, I had a flash back of my anorexic friend and I thought, "I'm not sure this time.".   I'm from Texas.  I know TexMex and I love it.  No offense, to the other Yelpers who have used the term, but this is not TexMex.  This is more like a Mexi-Mess!  I ordered the chili relleno and green chili corn tamale which was presented in a foil tin mixed with refried beans and rice.  I'll give them credit for the beans and rice.  That was good, but the rest...hmmmm.  The chili relleno was drowned in a glob of greasy cheese.  I'm not trying to say, that the chili relleno is the healthy choice.  It's breaded and sometimes fried.  It is never soggy or submerged in goo...unless you order from Julio's Too.  As for the green chili tamale.  In Texas, tamales are much smaller.  The corn (or maize as they say) is much more understated allowing the filling to really stand out.  This tamale was like a men's size 12 corn shoe with a little bit if cheese and green chili inside.  It was also, encased in a tomb of cheese that I had to dig through before I finally found the tamale.  I won't go in to the salsa.  The other Yelpers got it right.    Now, I do like the location, the vibe and the service.  I would ride my bike over there for chips and guacamole with friends.  They have a convenience store selection of beverages and a nice patio, which merit an extra star.  I'm not trying to be a jerk with this review, but this is just what I think.

_9pv7KQn5-RvW573MQH7gA.text: A family friend talked about this place all the time, so my friend and I finally went when we were in the area. It was great! Even though most places do this, I love that free chips come with your meal!! It was almost overwhelming because they have a very large menu, but I just got a bean and cheese burrito and I thought it was great! I would definitely go back.

qSX9-B1uL67GzdmhjpsJog.text: Went here for my lunch break and my experience was actually pretty good. I had a carne asada burrito and it was great...they didn't skimp on the meat like some chains do! The chips and salsa wasn't the best, but edible. Service was good...fast and friendly. It was packed and got even busier as we ate our food. One thing I did like...although not a big Pepsi fan, they had bottled Pepsi from Mexico, which is always tasty with Mexican food. Prices were about average. I'll be back for another burrito. I'd go here over their competitor down the street.

-9c8bgwNaSbCeQGPL-LRqQ.text: Julio's Too is a great place to get your tex-mex fix quickly & satisfactorily. The menu is really big and there are a lot of vegetarian options. I give them a high rating because the veggie taco salad has to be one of the best I've ever had, and I've eaten a ton of taco salads. They put real romaine lettuce in it, a ton of freshly sauteed veggies, a light sprinkling of cheese, good black beans, and a nice healthy dollop of fresh & good guacamole. I also had a green corn tamale which was alright, but the sauce (which you have to pay extra for but is totally worth it) is amazing - it's flavorful, thick, comforting. The tamale itself seemed a little dry, mushy, and bland to me. I didn't really like the free chips (too thin) & their free salsa (boring flavor) didn't impress me much.

Lzwdl10Kx3cQLs8dk7ZCHw.text: Julio's is great.  Maybe it's just the nostalgia from my college days at ASU, where I would eat at the Julio's near campus (now closed) on a weekly basis.  But I still go out of my way to come to the Scottsdale Julio's to eat, because I really like the food.  Their portions are huge.  I love their tacos, tamales, tostados, and enchiladas.  And their salsa is amazing,  So fresh and tasty!   I hope this place stays open, because it's one of the few places where you can get good Mexican take out.  If only I lived closer.

Yhg95kDO5Kzk8Wtu2Lin4A.text: i love this place! i love greasy mexican food and this place has the best! the tacos are so delicious and the chips are always fresh!

96k2Op6aam2Dqt5utnuw4A.text: This place is great.  The lunch specials cannot be beat and everything comes with free chips and salsa.

Ud4-yc_KiibjAbQTOLvT1Q.text: My girlfriend and I ate there last weekend around 8:45pm and around 9:15 or so, we walked next door to the W hotel to look at the car club lamborghinis that they had parked in front, we were gone for about 30 minutes or so and returned around 9:45 and my truck had been towed, I had to pay over $20 for a taxi to get home and then drive all the way across town to pick up my truck the next morning and had to pay another $75 to retrieve it! I was extra angry, however after speaking to the manager, Carlos, and having him investigate whether or not I actually ate there he was still reluctant to refund me the $75 dollars for the tow. Luckily, I recorded the entire conversation I had with the Julios workers on my cell phone and after explaining that if he would not refund me, I would be posting the discriminatory videos to YouTube right away, he finally gave me my $75 back. Needless to say, if you go here make sure not to park in their parking lot and also this place sucks even though they refunded me as it took over a week of dispute and too much effort for them to right their wrong!

smNaf500lJUDytAHLcPufg.text: Came here for a late lunch as we wanted to try a new Mexican place since we are still desperately looking for our go to Mexican restaurant.  We decided beforehand if the food wasn't going to be good, we would have back up and eat at the W Hotel at Sushi Roku. If you didn't know this, the W Hotel is right across the way.  First and foremost the parking is tight here so whether you're eating inside or outside on the small patio know that you'll have to wait around until someone leaves the lot or park around the corner if you want to be walking distance to your car.  As soon as we walked in were greeted by a nice young girl. She was friendly and directed us towards the lunch menu which was decently priced. As usual, we're still looking for a Mexican restaurant to replace our fave and legendary taco place in Santa Fe, New Mexico called the El Parasol, so we ordered the shredded beef tacos.  The order came with free chips and salsa. The salsa was available in both hot and mild. The food came out on paper plates within 10 minutes of ordering. The food was lukewarm. Beans and rice not hot at all and the taco, while it looked robust, tasted like it was just microwaved. Surprisingly though the taco was filled nicely to the rim with lettuce, cheese, and the shredded beef.  As soon as we took a bite of the (hard shelled) taco we could taste that the taco meat was soft and seasoned nicely but the taco shell was very stiff almost sharp and remember no warmth. The texture and taste was unbalanced. You had soft meat that was enveloped by a shell which to the taste was lukewarm.  Hungry after a 30 minute drive to this restaurant, we both ate the tacos as they were edible and only took 2-3 bites of the rice and beans (since they both were lukewarm in temperature).  Since we were still hungry and on the other side of town there was no turning back...thinking maybe we ordered the wrong thing here and still hungry, we decided to give it another try and order one beef tamale. The tamale was over $5.00. Unlike our lunch combo plates our one tamale took awhile to serve. In fact it was almost 15 minutes before it came out.  When the tamale finally came to our table, we both forked it and each took a bite. We were surprised that the tamale came out hotter then any of the other food we got there. As soon as both swallowed we said the same thing...  The tamale was too salty to eat any further.  Then my husband suggests that maybe it's just the sauce. Or just the meat or just the tamale skin that is salty. Since it was my idea I guess I was going to be the guinea pig. After two bites, I realized that every part of the tamale was over salted and I stopped eating. My husband hates salty food so our meal was officially over. Luckily, Happy Hour was starting at Sushi Roku, our back up place.  While we got good service from the staff and the prices are decent, it's safe to say that we have yet found our go to Mexican place in Arizona.
