oeXDRtHZucjqvkkHARuiQg.text: Best place for easy Mexican food on a budget in old town opens early for lunch. Carnitas Dinner is my favorite

ecK370IM85NW88BihiDlQQ.text: Very good little take-out, diner specializing in Mexican fare.  The prices are reasonable and the food is delicious!  The serving sizes are also large so plan on leftovers.  They bring ample chips & salsa and while the salsa is not the best I've had, the chips are warm and I assume made in-house.   I get the Carnitas (pork) which is about $12 for the dinner

jMjRoO5pKvU6fdOW40gJTQ.text: Thank you for great food and service this Mother's Day. Julios too was busy

2LdY6AEq-RXzS3b_tXJgoA.text: Incredible food! Great service!  You just can't beat this place if you have a hole in your stomach and it can only be filled by some kickass Mexican food! I highly recommend coming here for the variety of beverages, tasty food, and friendly service.

zRLPzWponqFg4plaL8Ha9Q.text: This a local favourite and the food is pretty darn good. We ate in this time - there was 5 of us and the restaurant wasn't busy. The food servings are pretty decent and the service is always friendly. It has a strong 'to go' service so it's pot luck on whether you get it on a busy or quiet period - but the service is fast and efficient. Tastes are great, they have a super good menu with lots of choices and a variety of beers.

VJFie-SIrJsIesJWBjLvEw.text: Really solid food.  I wish I was here another day to go back.  Little place that doesn't look like it would be all that from the outside but phenomenal food, friendly staff, and very reasonably priced.  Please open up a location in Las Vegas.

S5xU0CnMZItv-Eb0kcYxbQ.text: I've been coming here for a couple years now. Their burritos and tacos are great! They've always been great on consistency to me.   I'll be honest, and I'm sure you can relate, When you find a good regular place to go to you kinda get stuck rotating the same few things. I don't ever consider soup unless I'm going to a soup spot, or if am sick. But their soup is sooo good and it's perfect for the cold weather. It definitely has a kick, and if you like the kind that just lingers and reminds you it's there, but still calm enough to enjoy your food, then you should give it a try.   The folks who own it are really kind and they really have a great thing going. Cheers to this beautiful local business!

dxOesdpbkdpTgSHWYb9p0A.text: This was our first stop after arriving in the Phoenix area from Alabama and we were not disappointed.  We ordered a little of everything!  The mini chimichangas with dipping sauce were AMAZING!  The margarita was also delicious.  I ordered the special (can't remember the name, but it was amazing)!  We would definitely return on our next trip!

x05QTCOeRWw0Dg2X9sQ-1g.text: Great food, fast friendly service. If I'm area try for lunch and sit in beautiful outdoor seating area. Right outside Old Town so perfect place to relax with good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZKfG1pt6igBzx5HBaKAfYg.text: Walked here for lunch one day.  We ordered the Mexican Pizza and Pollo Magnifico and everything comes with chips and salsa.  I liked my burrito so much that I ended up eating way too much :).  The prices are amazing for what you get as well.  The location is small without great ventilation but this should not stop you!

P1AnVO61sS6shcEGDhiY4w.text: I don't think I've ever had a bad experience at Julio's. I love the mini chimis (comes with jalapeno cream cheese) and the queso dip - both are to die for! You get free chips and salsa (they have both mild and hot) with your order and the staff is super attentive and always asks if we need more. The service is quick and everyone is so nice, it really has a home-y feel to it.   They have a good selection of beers, both local and name brands. They cater, and while I've never thrown a party fancy enough to need catering, when I've been to events catered by them the food is still superb.   Parking can be tight in the lot, especially since people park there to go to old town (despite the fact you'll get towed), but there is street parking near by.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken mini chimis with jalapeño cream cheese

6hJU_rjekEisaz1cirPAHw.text: All time favorite Mexican restaurant. I can't believe I have never reviewed it. I've even hooked all my co-workers on the place, not to mention many friends. Everything here is pretty fantastic. My favorites are the beef tacos, Mexican pizza with machacha beef, pollo magnifico, enchiladas, mini chimis, spinach queso. The list goes on and on. And the staff there is amazing. I've rarely had items missing from my orders because they go to such great lengths to make sure it's right. There is no where in the area that does Mexican the way they do Mexican. It's why they are the best and everyone loves them.

8lskbM1cP92usic5GaYx0w.text: This place is great for some decently priced Mexican food in this part of town. You can expect to pay about $10/person if you're getting a combination plate, and you can either take your food to go or eat in their little dining area inside or on their patio. I've had their bean and cheese burrito (which is only about $4), and I was not disappointed. The portions are pretty big, and everything tastes super fresh.   This is definitely the spot to go to if you're wanting to grab some Mexican food to take home, but the ambience inside is a bit bleh.

eAcXP6uA4y9vcI3MN38tag.text: Cute little walk up service restaurant. Great customer service, awesome prices. We're from California & it was legit Mexican food. I had the chili rellano & shredded beef taco. Tasted great.

bIWmJWMm_I7Nv6CT0iJeWA.text: Seems a bit overhyped in this bar filled neighborhood.  Perhaps the constant infusion of alcohol in the patrons helps skew the ratings?  Not sure... In any case everything we tried here was over fried and just tasted like fryer oil with indistinct flavored fillings.  The tamals were covered with a pound of melted cheddar but were extremely dry, sweet and with little filling to be found.  Not really worth the time.

DbTJz7mEoQa5rE7ppk9JzQ.text: Good food, good margaritas, great prices and friendly laid back place, have been here several times. Not fancy but great for a quick casual place to eat

i9RTh1TSCciJQaPvrpBeIw.text: On a temporary job in old town Scottsdale and cannot stop eating here for lunch. Everything I've tried is awesome!! Plus they have $2.50 margaritas all day!! As long as I don't have to get back to work. This is a must if your in old town.

BiWfMmM09fZBCCHsagCyOg.text: This is a fantastic stop for great chips, salsa, and guacamole. Not to mention the $3 margaritas! We will definitely be back when we are in Scottsdale and staying at the W.

gDqoW_lzI1wYWxMeorpvlw.text: Decent food but don't come on Christmas Eve we prepaid and still waited well over an hour for our food.

DqaLCKgCTzJGf9WWdsun5A.text: I'm from Texas, so I'm used to Tex-Mex, and this was a little different, mostly in a good way.  I had a combo to try some different things. 1) Beef taco - fantastic, the taco shell was fresh and the beef was delicious 2) Red beef tamale - the biggest tamale I have ever seen.  Maybe too big, as the beef flavor was lost 3) Bean burrito - fairly plain, beans and some cheese in a tortilla, no sauce or anything.  The rice and beans were good, and the side of guac I got tasted just like I make at home, so I was happy with it.  The margarita was also decent, nothing fancy but tasty and with a salted cup - not frozen junk out of a machine, but freshly made.  Unfortunately the salsa didn't impress me, but I think that is because I'm used to a thicker salsa.  It was runny with some chili seeds that gave a little kick, but not a lot of flavor.  I'd go back though, I think I'd try a chimi or more tacos next time.

-wJjT6DFw4SlitBFxxBWyg.text: Mexican Restaurant. This is a hidden gem.  They have the best take out for Mexican Food.  A must try.

sHoNgTbDgPzQmCLpnTCpYw.text: The food is decent for the price, and we eat here fairly often.  The chips are good, as is the salsa.  My family eats everything from burritos, tacos, to mini chimichangas, and all are flavorful.  My only real complaint is that the service isn't great.  The people who work the counter are monotone and border on rude half the time.  They are also stingy with chips when you order to go.  They give you a decent amount when you eat in, but with a to go order, they balk at giving you enough for the order.   Other than that - no real complaints and will continue to frequent for the food.

KXw6OOeMUeiZ0ieLhEBncw.text: Eh, not bad, not great! Not a fan of Mexican food anyway unless it is authentic and I am at Gallo Blanco, Frank and Lupe's, or Barrio Cafe. However, that said, this place is not so bad. Cheap and lots of food. When in Scottsdale and you are desperate for a late dinner after visiting the bar scene check it out. I liked their sit down restaurant once upon a time but they closed their doors. This is what's left. It reminds me of a school lunch cafeteria in a way. lol! Hey I ate here last night with my guy and you know what? I actually really liked the Chili Rellenos and their sauces. I am very picky about salsas and sauces from all the Mexican restaurants I worked at over the years. Their hot sauce is really good.

ayF7BjRDQLbQ-wgs6GXtSA.text: Thanks, Yelpers, for reaquainting me with this establishment.! This is really good TexMex, very inexpensive, and you get tons of food for very little money.  I had the 2 item combo with a shredded beef taco (big, wonderful and filling) but didn't stop there, and ate the beef burrito too (oink, I am) ...and I managed to consume enough rice and beans and chips to blow myself into the next county (ok, I'll stop there)... Good food, great prices, and it's casual and quick.  Loved it!

U_5yZ1cHvACPmyV2wLtAtA.text: I stepped out of my comfort zone of carby, cheesey grease and tried the fish taco (orange roughy) combo.  It was good.  The fish was not breaded and was cooked perfectly.  I could have done without the rice and beans to save calories, but those were good too.  They give a mayonaisey salsa mixture to put in your tacos.  It was pretty good, but I think fresh lemons or limes to squeeze over the tacos would have been better.    If you are not a carb queen, this was a good choice and relatively healthy.

bMoNQMPZ2rXynPBNsTt08g.text: This place fails. Just totally fails. I was forced to eat here one night even though all I wanted was a delicious burrito from one of the -erto's, Betos, or Fiesta Burrito. But no, I was coerced into coming here because they're "open late" and my friend swore up down and backwards that it was "amazing". I really should have known better because her favorite Mexican place is Arriba-really?! I feel bad for her, because there's so much great Mexican food in this town!   OK, so they decided to extend their hours, but you know what? THEY CUT THEIR MENU TO FIVE ITEMS AFTER 1 AM! Not cool.   Pro: The golf cart that drove us here from Dos Gringos...apparently it's a club shuttle, but has "Julio's Too" written all over it, and the guy driving it said he's work for them for 10 years and that the owner of the golf shuttle also owns Julio's Too. This driver claimed everything here was "delicious" but couldn't be specific about any item. Hmmmm, I wonder if that's because...  Con: THE FOOD SUCKED. It was just plain bad. I mean, I eat from some grimy burrito places, and their food is AMAZING compared to the stuff they're passing off as food here. Maybe it's because we went late, but either way I decided to play it safe and order a bean and cheese burrito that I could barely eat five bites of before completely giving up on it. Others in my party ordered the carne asada burrito (oh, I should mention that I was the only sober one here-everyone in my party was absolutely sloshed), and most of them ate all of it, but later told me how bad it was and what a bad idea it was to eat it. They said they would have much rather gone to a good place (which I agreed with!), and collectively we all agreed never to come here again.   Next time you see the Julio's Too shuttle driver pass by, ask him for a ride to the nearest GOOD Mexican place! Or even the philly cheesesteak place near the bars which is decent. Just stay away from this place.

ZkiiwSIE2AvSedVxHcaEsw.text: Mini Chimis!!! That jalapeno cream cheese is so addicting! And the seafood enchiladas were great! Just get ready for a major food coma

p4PKRL2gNIi2Px_XPG1zwA.text: Service here was great. Quick and delicious. Variety of food was perfect to appease everyone in our group. Loved their chips and salsa.

fXmBT9SF4rtxTCOQMdMGbA.text: Best Mexican take out...its fast and delish. There prices are a little all over the place, but overall it's a good value, when you get the lunch specials or the 2 or 3 item combos. The fajita quesadilla with either chicken or Carne asada is to die for and comes with sour cream, pico de gallo and guacamole which is definitely my go to meal there! My husband loves the 3 item combo (which is always enough food to feed too grown men) with the green corn tamale and (he gets two) chili rellenos. Yum! You get chips and salsa with every order, even to go and they are generous with their salsa! Other then the fact that I am not crazy about eating inside and sometimes if you order no beans you get them anyway...Your food is at least stove hot and made to order. I have nothing bad to say about this place! only that I think we eat there or take home food from there way to often...

Qc-06PtiFt_c8MtKX1m2vg.text: One of the only restaurants that I actually CRAVE.  I am a forever fan.  The food is great, the service is great, the place is clean and the prices are low for the portion.  If you are looking for some great Mexican and you're in the area, this is the place to go!

tnPlG1AOdmNbl5CzaBaVmA.text: Just crappy Mexican food the best part was the Mexican flag in my food. But this a disgrace to Mexico in every way possible. Every single menu item taste the same.  The salsa is watery and nasty. Don't waste your time.

W4-UfY7SJdrGJzX5l_3ZFQ.text: I love the mini chimis here!  They are the best!  The food on its own gets five stars.  They could be a little more generous with their salsa, but other than that, this place is wonderful.  :)

pMP4_4oF4SOmQBG6XWw8YA.text: I have been looking for a good mexican takeout place, and this one is great! Had the chips and salsa and a chicken flauta, both were fantastic! :)

E8lXLBTvYl5o-3-_YR2O6A.text: I've driven past before. Finally tried it a couple weeks ago. Not your typical scottsdale joint. Good prices. The staff are so sweet. The food is amazing. I've gotten the tamales, chicken tacos, burrito, beans and rice. All were delicious! They are speedy when ordering to dine in or to go. Definitely will be returning.

GpC1FXES4AzjzP7aGgiYJg.text: I eat here just about every weekend before work. Everything i get is great, especially the beef mini chimis. And The people that work there are always super friendly!

bURMJPvb8QeISMO1DWJBEg.text: While I don't quite agree with everything Colin S has to say he essentially sums up Julio's Too. It's horrible. I ordered the veggie burrito, now you don't have to. It is disgusting. Don't bother with the salsa, It comes from a jar. You would have to be really wasted to actually eat here and think it is anything but hideous. Colin S is also correct on the parking. The lot was full but there was no one in the restaurant. One of the worst Mexican restaurants I have had the misfortune of dining at.

XJGEW9aVB5YCQG6IillY3A.text: Yummy, yummy, yummy!  I had crispy, greasy, packed with meat tacos just like I like `em.  The beans and rice were great and the chips are the thinnest, most crispy delights I've had in a long time! The staff was super nice too. This place is super casual and good.

_Gtv5HUCOG8aywZeP7dajw.text: Pros: Good food            Big place            Good costumer service Cons:             Awful margarita

NI3HCmSponqGax-x1DjxMQ.text: This place is amazing! First and foremost the staff is awesome, and the place is clean. I eat there about every 2 weeks and the food is always good! Born & raised right here in Az with a wide variety of Mexican restaurants, I always come back to Julio's.   This year for my family Christmas party we ordered platters from Julio's, everything was perfect, they even made sure I had enough chips & salsa.   This place is a must try!!

zL9oP6IqUL41VD951OnWIA.text: My friend had been telling me about this place since I visited last year and was finally able to try this past weekend and it was everything she said it was!  The food was delicious and those margaritas are sooo worth it! The chimichangas are delicious.   And the Mexican pizza is a MUST HAVE! It is delicious and huge .. I wish I would have taken a picture of it but the other pictures of it posted are accurate! Can't wait to go back!

8aDtwp2sbgh6LNl025A55w.text: Average Mexican food. After dining here, I thought to myself "why didn't I pay 1/2 the price and go to Chipotle across the street for a more enjoyable meal?".   We got the steak fajitas, 3 item combo (beef enchilada, chicken enchilada, chili relleno), and a shredded beef taco salad. Although the taco salad has a great presentation, they skimped on the meat and it was bland. The taco shell was more soggy than crispy. The enchiladas were mediocre at best and the relleno was decent. The only dish that was good enough to get again were the fajitas.   Mix all this in with a near 30 minute wait after ordering at the counter and next time I will head elsewhere. Yelp was a letdown on this one - I assume the reviewers are the entertainment district bar crowd.

1_hfmEaLeEqKEBXG7x3Bng.text: What a deal!! Build you own burrito and/or quesadilla for like $7. Mistakenly ordered my burrito for dine-in and it was not wrapped in foil, it started falling apart after a few bites. That sucked, ended up finishing it off by using chips to scoop the insides out.   The quesadilla - MASSIVE!! By far, the BIGGEST quesadilla I have ever seen and for such an amazing price. Unbelievable. Tortilla was nice and crispy on the outside and the inside had tons of gooey melted cheese.   Dine-In came with a large basket of fresh crispy chips and little containers of their house made salsa. Mild was tasty. Hot had a nice little bite of smokiness to it.   Carne asada chunks were big, they definitely don't skimp on anything here.   Small spot but good amount of outdoor seating. Over a great little spot. There is a plethora of Mexican/taco/burrito places - if you're looking for inexpensive and huge portion, check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside. Good selection of drinks.
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own carne asada burrito.

JNM7kPEmWrhIqpzTYBHc1w.text: Julio's was a staple in my childhood... We used to go to the original Julio's all the time! So fast forward to now, Julio's two still serves up huge portions of tasty Americanized Mexican food for decent prices. They have yummy cheese crisps and chimis with jalapeno cream cheese.... It definitely isn't fancy, but it's good. I would be sure to check it out!

Z3A6BW1WEqEKmXAIr8yl9A.text: This place is awesome amazing food amazing service nothing bad to say about this place if you have a chance definitely go here

s1RBJkU7xYA_e7jq2REmvQ.text: I'm always skeptical of Mexican restaurants with items on their menus like salads and "Mexican pizza." Julio's Too is just ok. I ordered takeout and there was no crispiness to my chimichanga; I ate it pretty soon after pick up, it was soggy, and the machaca was just weird. The mini chimis were everything I wanted and I would definitely order them again. I've never done dine-in so I'm unsure if the quality is better.

Ck5kFRWtCOkoyXeIxNkijw.text: We really liked this place. This is no frills, order at the counter Mexican fare. Chips and salsa is included with your order and they are so good. It comes with both hot and mild salsa and both were great. For food I ordered the chicken fajita salad that came in a big taco shell. I loved the take on a traditional taco salad with ingredients I liked more. Everyone else in my group ordered different lunch specials and they were really pleased. There are $3 margs all day which is a great deal and they were pretty good.   There were two negatives to this place that took away a star for me. The first was that there were a lot of flies in the restaurant. I know they had the door open a lot so I'm sure they flew in, but it was pretty irritating / gross. It could have just been a random thing though. The second thing isn't a huge deal, but many of their hot sauces were out and they didn't have replacements. They should be sure to stock these appropriately.  Overall I would def recommend for the food. We saw a ton of orders being placed for takeout, and we all agreed if we lived here we would do the same frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken quesadilla
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken fajita taco salad

zF6PoPZJZZfClm1e_k9rpg.text: Stopped in for a quick bite - wanted some crispy shredded beef tacos. Something simple. This place is super simple. It's what you think of when you think quick and cheap Mexican food. It's not going to knock your socks off but it will satisfy your craving. Also they have great drink prices. They even have white claws.

rrhP6Tx2wa0QqeJNsRwkyA.text: So disappointing. I've had better Mexican food back home in Connecticut.  Food was cold, how that happens when it's 100 out, I've no idea. Chicken taco had more lettuce than meat. Chicken Flauta was greasy, both were flavorless.

J92iIOtEP2D4l20deJO80Q.text: Okay, so there isn't much here for vegetarians besides tortillas (which I can't confirm use lard or not) and cheese. The enchilada sauce even has meat products in it.   I would say, the $2.50 margaritas are definitely worth the visit, but the food for us veggies out there is lacking.

r_auVG-l9GiIovLcqRAMsQ.text: This place has been here for a LONG time, although I believe the original location used to be over on Indian School. I had always wanted to try it so I finally did one Friday. I can't say enough about the friendly service. The chefs and servers went out of their way to make sure they got my order correct (I ordered my enchiladas "Christmas Style" which is a big thing in New Mexico, but not so much here in AZ, so they wanted to make sure they got it just right! ) I had cheese enchiladas and a tostada as well as the mini chimichangas, and I had enough food for the whole weekend!! The tostada alone would have been a meal by itself, holy cow it was huge!! They serve chips and salsa with the meal and those were really good (I'm a cilantro-hater and there was no cilantro in the salsa, yay!) I can't wait to come back and try the flavored margaritas woot!! They have some really, really cool Historic photos of classic Arizona articles on the wall inside that are really neat to read too...definitely a place to check out for any AZ native who loves to see fun, historic/iconic things!! Right in the heart of Old Town across from the W Hotel with a fantastically huge patio that's puppy-friendly, (also excellent for people watching!)

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Margaritas! Can&#39;t beat all day HH...learn something new every day!

KZwQ9M_LGANiZBnR1K2lPA.text: We meet another couple for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the staff and food. Disappointed by the parking and loud, obnoxious people. Will return.

6WA0E-WH5ZPkPT7Ud8dnWw.text: Have been wanting to try this place for a while now as it is just down the street and I've seen great reviews. We Postmate'd our order and at first glance I was very impressed. The Mini Chimichangas looked crispy on the outside and the portions were large. Unfortunately as I was eating the Chimichangas I noticed there was something else mixed into the meat. It was like this weird soft cartilage but in strips (similar to a sheet of beancurd if you know what that is lol) I lost my appetite after seeing it and went through each chimi only to find there was at least a couple strips in every one. I don't know what they are but definitely unappetizing. My friend chose the better route getting vegetarian food, but she said there was nothing special about her food.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Weird things in the Mini Chimichangas
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bean Tostada

VS4EuwCi7CZYqyLkWJBHKg.text: Food was ok, nothing really exciting about this place. The local neighbors seem to really like it. It wasn't authentic enough like it seemed. Prices were great just not impressed with the food.

nuuAW2RookcR3MMnNDPKhA.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever been too. Prices are shockingly cheap. Food is delicious. The fried burrito was perfect and so was the Mexican pizza. I'd eat here all the time if I could. Great deals on margaritas too.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexican Pizza
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried burrito

gbkN6od0fAmsG0yjUynuxw.text: Been here more than a few times after finding them on Yelp a couple years back.   The cashier's here are pretty slow in my opinion, it always takes a while for me to order. The one thing I like is that they give you chips and salsa while you wait for your food. Prepare to wait. This is not a taco shop, this is a fast casual Mexican restaurant.  The food here is okay, some options are better than others. My favorite are the tamales which are pretty good. I've also had just about every taco on the menu and the carnitas as well (which I would never order again). The beans and rice also aren't that good, they're not bad just not that good.  Overall it's not a bad option if you're looking for serviceable Mexican food in old town.

WZ-cbuki-7GqrSt0_1KBaA.text: Hot lettuce on my chicken taco...no other condiments. Just gross. The tamale was ok and beans and rice were fine. Overall, unimpressed. I know I can find better tacos in Scottsdale!

SyPUpmwLCtfNMfE0AG1cKg.text: My new favorite Mexican food place to eat cheese enchiladas!! Too bad they are all the way in Arizona...but the food here is so good! Thank you to the lady working at the Fiesta Bowl Museum for suggesting this place to eat lunch at! She said this is her and her grandson's favorite Mexican food place, that even while eating at another Mexican place he said that he liked this place better. The unlimited warm chips and salsa is just a bonus to what this place has to offer. We ordered cheese enchiladas, beef tacos, carne asade tacos, flautas, and a tamale. It was simply delicious!! This would be the first place I come to when I visit Arizona again.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flautas!
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheese enchiladas
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef tacos

SHi0wMgqiCOzs07RU8ZGEw.text: Go here go here GO HERE!! Wow! Amazing. Everything. I'm from Southern California and this place is legit. Ended up here for dinner twice during a business trip. Shredded beef tacos, their queso with spinach (as an app or in an enchilada with chicken) and the best chimichanga I've ever had. Can't say enough good things about this family business. Lovely service....free chips and salsa...cheap drinks. Just go.

2Qpo6h39_FTHDJFT5RKx4g.text: I've been here multiple times to pick up lunch. Everything is really good and they have great prices! One thing I would remark on is the customer service isn't that great, also expect to wait awhile even if it's not that busy. The food is seriously so good though! Definitely a good place to go to to grab some lunch! I recommend the smothered burrito or the mini chimis!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ob1BzkgntS8rY4541d5gwQ.text: Lunch specials are a good bang for your buck! The quality of food is very good for the price. A coworker recommended it and I am so happy they did.  Their machaca is very flavorful and delish! As mentioned before be prepared for a food coma.

sDO7noLVTZicnxHkxeLPdg.text: I went into Julio's yesterday for lunch.  Didn't start with a good impression at all.  When I ordered my margarita I was asked for my ID.  Understandable.  I've worked in the restaurant industry for 10+ years, I get it.  But I didn't even get a smile, or even eye contact.  I then stood there for about 5 minutes while the employees passed around my out-of-state license (I just moved here a few months ago, and I'm 24, btw).  I found this pretty unprofessional.  The older blonde was cashing me out and piled on the attitude.  If she had rolled her eyes one more time, I'm pretty sure they'd roll right out of her head.  The younger gentleman who brought out my burrito put the food down and walked away... that's it.    My point is... if you like food, you miiiiiight like this place, it was mediocre.  If you like good service, don't waste your time.  If I was the owner of this restaurant, I would be embarrassed to employ these people.  They were rude, condescending, and pretenscious.    I had the spinach and chicken burrito.  It was meh.  The margarita was great, but came in a plastic cup... pretty anticlimactic and non-environamentally friendly.  BOOOOOOO!

ZCCzhPZ2uyxyRU25VVc_Sg.text: Ew. Not the best Mexican food. The plates are too greasy and the guacamole tastes like it came from a can. Even the chips were meh. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

8jU2hmlI1IyCb2NdDX4InQ.text: The food is GREAT, in my experience.  I'm sure, you'll agree, that FOUL MOUTHED ..... reviewer Collin S. .......IS A WANNABE RAPER.  Checkout the Language in this review, and all of his reviews.  Glad your wheels were towed.

gvNL1T0CxwgVBnJcVDcuKQ.text: Soooo good! Chicken tacos and cheese enchiladas are the best!  Their staff is so friendly and the chips and salsa (get the hot!) are yummy! When we ate here they were playing an 80's station too - perfect!

SOKqonC7KZLKtFX8ikwe9Q.text: Classic texmex great for kids and the whole fam. Cervezas and margaritas served cold. Mini chimis are among my favorite items to get before work. Good to share or pig out on if your really hungry. Overall great place to go!

K2AyJDM7ngbHDcZraq4zaw.text: Yum Yum. I like Julios too. It doesn't look like it from the outside, but they have tables inside and they also have a patio so you have a lot of options of dining in or getting takeout. If you come for lunch the lunch specials are cheap but you are going to be lethargic when you go back to work. They also have drinks in here which seems kind of random. I've only gotten a margarita here once but it seemed pretty strong for the $3 or whatever it was. Also, you get free chips and salsa which is always a plus in my book. The carne asada tacos are my fave, but I like the taco salad and the green corn tamale is delish as well.

eLNMxVc5Jh8O-Gp2N5rMtA.text: Excellent food and service. Ordered 2 flautas lunch special. Both the chicken and beef were great. Chips and salsa were stellar! Would Highly recommend it.

UvUKK244QBtuKN67tvpXmg.text: Great place to grab a quick bite.  Friendly, affordable and perhaps my favorite enchilada sauce in town.   Great take out and quick service without sacrificing flavor or quality.

9dmJ95oJq60C572S-88Z2g.text: Delicious and a great value!  Every time I crave Mexican food, I go here!  I typically share the 3 Item Combo for $9.95 and it's always perfect!  Whether we order the green corn tamale, chicken taco, bean tostada, enchilada, it's all great!  Chips and Salsa are tasty too!  Enjoy!

V4qP49FkppSedMjifnFqpQ.text: Very tasty quick stop. Carne asada tacos were delicious. Portion sizes were huge, so go there hungry.

4tItntJfm_avgw0IKnLt3Q.text: This is our go to lunch spot when I visit my sister.  It is one of the best fast mexican food places around.  They have great salsa, queso, and chips.    Try: - Queso - Spinach Enchiladas - Tacos  The inside is kinda small but they have a good sized patio to sit outside.

QvocHLovLPPv2inJeZlI1g.text: Really friendly service. Quick and excellent food. Light, fluffy tamales- not heavy gutbombs. Green chili pork burrito was very good as well. Definitely will return!

PocuOfYgSgeeCHxej0W2eA.text: Not only is this place great for a quick and tasty Mexican dinner, but the employees here are FANTASTIC as well! My husband and I frequent J-Too a lot, I didn't realize how much until today. My husband was on his way home from work, and unfortunately was hit by a red light runner right in front of this restaurant. When I arrived to the scene, one of the employees came out and gave us some cold water bottles, and then said he remembers us from when we dine in, he said he was sorry to see the accident and hopes my husband recovers quickly, then he offered us a discount on dinner. His kindness was so appreciated during this stressful and scary time! Then, while we were eating our meal another customer's car battery died, and I think the manager offered to find jumper cables and help charge their battery. It was so cool to experience and see these guys go the extra step! We'll be back! Thanks again!!

Z6twCBF5ljQPa9lw7QA5aA.text: Tried the chicken tacos.  i have also ordered a combo of a cheese enchilada, relleno, and a beef taco.  All were delicious.  Best Mexican I have had in Old Town.

eNPzhAMTL2FexWJaxQSZ-w.text: This is one of those places where you go by default.  It's late. Or it's lunch. Nothing is nearby. Very few things are open. Julio's is right there. It's cheap. Why the hell not?  This place is pretty damn solid.   It's unhealthy. It's delicious. It's the perfect "after party" food. Catch my  drift?  Service can be a little slow, but whatevs.

6qNVBkqQlsoM1K2BQUbYVg.text: A great place to get some excellent Mexican food in a casual setting.  You order at the counter and the food is delivered to you table.  We had lunch there on a Saturday and the place was hopping.  Excellent food and service.  You will not be disappointed.

AZxofiIJf7JQXlUCKEgFOQ.text: Good, close to work, and cheap!  I'd recommend if you're in the area for a quick lunch. It's tight quarters inside the restaurant so I find takeout to be the best (work is close so it's easy to eat in the office).  Overall, I'd definitely recommend. I've only ordered lunch which is very reasonably priced and very, very filling!

qH98smMGq2wZUeq-V3gASA.text: I work pretty close to this place and we order take out quite a bit. The food is always great and they always get our order right, which seems to be quite rare nowadays at a lot of other places. The lunch menu has good food for good prices and makes it very convenient to place to-go orders for my work (2-5 orders). Highly recommended if you are looking for great mexican food.

9kyQDgf5wURKVyDnDzxqyg.text: What makes this just ok is the salsa... Can't say it enough it SUCKS!!! The premixed Margs are good a couple of the large ones and you're feelin it. Plenty of beer options if you prefer. Portions are large and tasty.

kvzM1_-wEjLCrikrdxP-RQ.text: Yummmm amazing.... i you want good Mexican food and good margaritas. This is the place to go. It's always busy but you are in and out. Lunch specials are great. Love this place.

k4UkbqcFH8w36tZDYqcO7Q.text: Dang...Julio's dishes out some pretty tasty Mexican food!  The chips and salsa were so tasty and I probably ate way too many before our meals came out.  The cheese enchiladas with rice and beans were so tasty...I am actually craving these again while writing this review.  Super friendly staff, quick service and amazing and simple food done right!

cMj_WRBQ4bNIkTZKIqJEUQ.text: The food is awesome. This place used to be a sit down restaurant, but now it's mostly takeout. The people at the counter are nice and very efficient.   Everything I have eaten here is authentic from old Arizona restaurants. It's like you would expect at a taco stand where all your old friends get their comida Mexicana.

O4VAI_jpyBKzudDetczZVg.text: Last time I was in Scottsdale was December and I really didn't have a chance to try a good local spot. This time I made sure to do just that.   Based solely on Yelp reviewers we decided to try this place. Even though its a mexican eatery, something about it seemed different. It was.   I had the Lunch Pollo Magnifico that was recommended by the nice lady taking orders. I was hesitant because of the jalapeno sour cream they put on it. I was wrong and that ended up being the piece that brought everything together. This fried burrito was amazing! I'm normally not a fan of chicken in burritos because it always seems dry to me. Not here. The chicken was seasoned and very tender.   If you are in the area and you are able to find a parking spot in their tiny lot, I would recommend stopping here.   One star removed due to the mild salsa tasting like it came from a jar (not from new york city...)

9m-90bxj5e9c3OyNgj_KWg.text: I'm not sure why this place doesn't have 5 stars???!!!    The Mini Chimis are wonderful with the cream cheese Jalapeno dip.   Tacos are always right on.  And who can resist the $2.50 Margaritas??? Staff is always helpful.  Only thing I would change is the staff should check on you if you need more chips and salsa :)

sxNHA3sJYR9swjQmlJ8MJA.text: Love this place. My family has been going here for fresh and delicious mexican food since 2000. More important than the great food, is the customer service. David always provides great customer service and is so welcoming to every customer. They know my order as soon as they see me coming in the door. I love the chicken fajitas and the taco's can't be beat! If it was closer to where we lived I would be here every week chowing down on the great salsa and chips!

EPnNRIRBhk-F0M5ExDck7w.text: This place is great. The service was amazing - the guy behind the counter was super helpful and seemed genuinely interested in how my day was going. The food was some of the best I've had - the red beef tamale is worth it if you're a fan of tamales!

4iJOrGmdGh_-zC7yAnYLzQ.text: My search for a Mexican Restaurant in AZ that compares to Southern California Mexican food is now over. This place is fantastic! My five stars is not just for the food, the customer service is phenomenal as well. My wife and I were greeted with warm smiles and friendly demeanors.  I had the three item combo which consisted of a chile relleno, cheese enchilada,  and shredded beef taco. The chile relleno I could tell was freshly made with a perfect crunch, unlike many places that make them ahead of time resulting in a soggy unflavorful mess hidden by loads of crappy sauce and cheese on top. The taco was bursting with authentic Mexican flavor and freshly grated cheese. The enchilada sauce was probably the best I've ever had,  definitely not from a can. My wife had the two taco meal and opted for a chicken and beef taco.  She kept talking about how much they reminded her of the amazing Mexican food we left behind in Orange County,  California, where there is an excellent Mexican place on every corner.   Our meal came with a basket of perfectly fried tortilla chips and delicious salsa.  We had the option of mild or hot salsa and I asked for one of each,  both being yummy. Upon leaving,  we asked to buy a bag of chips to bring back home with us.  The nice young man kindly bagged it for us and said "no charge,  have a great day"...a perfect ending to a wonderful experience.

eM39Ac_uLEyiM-4ZsvxZ2w.text: Nice staff and the food is great. I love their chips and their hot sauce! Fantastic. We are regulars now - we're there or picking up a to go order at least once a week.

lcLvY6PLCkSMLNFOXox7Lg.text: Best green corn tamales around. Great for takeout - small indoor and patio seating for dining in. Super casual ambiance, fantastic lunch specials, extremely good food and beyond reasonable prices. Fresh hot chips are always included with your order and beer/margaritas are available here as well. I understand they do a large amount of catering and have always wowed customers with exceptional service. This location had been in the heart of Old Town for as long as I can recall and I've never been disappointed. A must for anyone in the area.

LZ6Da10XU4IzxE9d8-wXcQ.text: Always have enjoyed my meals and service here. Nothing to rant or rave about but everything is pretty on point at this Mexican restaurant.   Pros - Decent food - Quick service - Good portions - Free chips and salsa  Cons - Not the greatest customer service - Crowded inside seating

SekW1DQVLYAckO7qFVc6XQ.text: Hard pressed to find an above avg. mexican food eatery in Scottsdale look no further than Julio's Too.  This place has quality food for your dollar.  Place your order then sit down at a clean table enjoy a cold one or a Margarita pick up your food take home or eat there.  Green Chile Corn Tamales very good , Beef Machaca Burrito excellent as well as the Spinach Enchiladas, the spicy salsa not over powering with hot and spicy ingredients ask for extra have some fun.  Parking is at a premium at this place that is the only challenge here as the food is pretty darn good.

hHz0vJlJbezlIlYwhJ2QtA.text: The food was pretty good, especially for the price. I definitely wasn't mad with the Pollo Con Queso!

vggD3lfBjQOdKldYmFCmhg.text: Holy crapoli this place is good. I could eat here a couple times a week and be perfectly content! We went in yesterday and got the mini chimichangas and some queso/chips. Both were great portions, extremely well priced and delicious! The salsa is fresh and somewhat sweet- almost as sweet and helpful as the employees! I definitely had leftovers and they are delicious even the next day! Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu!

_w0fkTDHfIfPL6aU6Y22IA.text: Best green corn tamales in Arizona.  Combos are magnificent with many choices. Have been a customer for more than 25 years.  Gets better and better!

waM_NLVo3Z-b8M-Zalx08w.text: I have been coming to Julio's for 15 years. Recently I have noticed the quality of the food has gone way down. Mini chimis are always good (hard to mess up), but the things that take more time and effort have been lacking. I think they are not trying hard anymore and it shows by the shorter lines and no one in the restaurant when I go.  Now, I just go to order mini chimis for my kids and go some place else for me. Sad, this used to be a staple in my family.

lRDxd9FyQ4ypeN9fj90o-w.text: I used to work near here and we got take out a lot.   My favorites: spinach enchiladas, green corn tamale, chicken mini chimis ( they come with a green chile cream cheese dip, OMG).   I loved their tex mex spin, not authentic Mexican, mind you, but tasty.   I can't speak to the service, I rarely went in to pick up, even... I'm one of those crafty people who can get others to do that, lol.   I liked it though.

PXhD5UUhUUsjVFxrtPJYlg.text: Have been going here a lot recently - they never disappoint! And now we found out their patio is dog friendly - we love it even more!   The food is always great, and the margaritas are tasty, and cheap. They are ALWAYS friendly! Love them!!

WfuqSw1ilxdytxV_Qg8kpg.text: Went here because of the "shop small" AmEx event. I love texmex food so I have been curious, but I don't think I will be back. Texmex is greasy, but when you eat part of your food and the one inch void in the container is filled with a clear liquid (oil) you lose your appetite.  Besides the food seemed like one step above Mexican day at school.  The snowbirds seem to love this place, but there are other options that involve less of a wait and less lubricant.

zZLRhGzyDp2r-V43MDundw.text: The only reason I went is because my Dad wanted a taco.  The last few times I have eaten here it has been nothing but a greasy mess.    I miss the days when Julio G's was down the street.  The quality control and level of care to the food has gone WAY down hill in the last few years, and it is really sad to see.    With it being right next to the W, you'd think they would strive to be the best place ever.  If I was staying there, I'd walk to downtown and find something else.

xC3ISEJBEoJRRj57KU562Q.text: Happy Hour Margarita for $2.50 how can you beat that! Great food and great service love this place!

yZLYvhPI7F3JbgGaL2RiMA.text: I was waiting in a long line for a concert and was feeling antsy. I wandered into Julio's Too looking for a bathroom, but I was distracted by all the delicious smells. I couldn't resist so I ordered one soft beef taco. It was only $3 and they also gave me a free bag of fresh piping hot chips and asked me what type of salsa I wanted. They loaded my bag with 3 cups of mild salsa, chips, and the beef taco. I lived in San Diego for 4 years and found the quality to be pretty authentic. It also helped make the line go faster as I munched away on my feastings.

TPhFL2whmzn7ZvNpZdoRIA.text: This place is fantastic. I've been visiting their Julio Too locations since the original Julio G's shut their doors. For fast and casual Mexican food, nothing beats it! I couldn't live life anymore if I didn't have my fix every week.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pollo magnifico

CqUIONiYqJ_IuR1U440pqA.text: Such a cute little place to have dinner with friends. Probably the best carne asada tacos I've ever had. The free chips and salsa are delicious and I love that they have different spice levels to choose from. Amazing place and has become my fiance and I's go to Mexican restaurant.

6C-vBuIA0HySYoZphiON2A.text: Super yummy crispy tacos and chicken fajitas.  My "Go to" for take out on the way home.

Rhy3iUKKH1O9Nnrng6ir0A.text: Awesome, local restaurant with solid food at a great time. The staff here is fantastic. Have been there for years and are very friendly. Julio's is a long time classic.

6O7ydjlJOKE8pMPCUSlERQ.text: I have been to Julio's too multiple time as it is a very dependable, always tasty spot satisfy my cravings for Mexican food. However, last night my boyfriend ordered a carnitas big burrito enchilada style and it was hands down THE BEST Mexican food I have had in my 4 years in the valley. The carnitas meat was out of this world. I don't know how they did it but I hope they keep doing it again and again and again. I had the spinach and chicken enchiladas which were no doubt delicious, but after I tasted the carnitas nothing could compare.

jAya9n2444-NQ8n1elH0JA.text: I feel like this would be great...if I were drunk.  My tostada was buried under a mountain of shredded cheeze and lettuce. I could barely taste what I was eating.  I'll give it 3 stars for now and decide on a + or - rating when I come back next....maybe I'll be drunk by then, the W pool party IS next door.  Perhaps that is where most of these possitive reviews are coming from... Drunk people leaving the W.

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enough lettuce for ya?

ACHVVCTgZ3Q7eg4G-FWDoQ.text: Very good service ! The guys were awesome very patient & recommended a few of their fav items  Free chips & salsa is always a bonus.  $2.50 all day happy hour margaritas is a nice touch.  The mild salsa is tasty but the hot is a little to hot and bland I mixed the two and it was just right.  I'll be back

aOtWBbXoD3_4EHrbn_WoqA.text: Good, cheap, and fast!. This is a place to go when you're craving Mexican food but don't want to spend Scottsdale type of money. My understanding is that its owned by one of the members of the Garcia's family, but unlike the restaurants which were sold by the family to a franchise chain, this place is still a local operation, much like Garcia's de las Avenidas at 35th Avenue and Encanto. It's basic, traditional, Mexican food that is homemade and tastes great.

9LMlvPLyMKos4TtX7latTA.text: Everyone is aware that Scottsdale is an upscale town with money to burn. My wife and I love looking for places where the tourists don't  go to and the locals eat great food. Juilo's  Too fits the bill. I always check out Yelp reviews to see what people have to say about a place I might go to . I was in the mood for tamales. A fellow Yelper said he had been coming to Julio's for the past 25 years for the Green Chile Tamales. I order the 3 item combo getting 2 Green Chile Tamales and one Red Beef Tamale. With a container of black beans and some rice the huge plate of food was not what I expected. I The Red Beef Tamale was very good but like the fellow Yelper said the star of my dish was the Green Chile Tamale. All 3 tamales were huge. The Red Beef Tamale had a very nice  Ranchero sauce. All of the tamales were smothered with cheese. My wife had a 2 item combo with a Black Bean Burrito and the Spinach Enchilada. Both dish were packed with so much food we didn't even eat a quarter of the great chips and salsa that comes before the meal. They have all day $2.50 margaritas which were nice. We had leftover galore. For under $35 we ate like royalty. Service was informative and very friendly. We  definitely  found a gem of a Mexican restaurant that is not fancy but has great food. As Dark Vader says" I'LL BE BACK".

LL6NsTyga3yvpAuYp9irMQ.text: Great price for the amount of food you get. Also, it taste great! Good location for all the nearby clubs and bars nearby.

u8DCjA9rcbdaR9rQ2aCk5A.text: this is a very family friendly restaurant. the employees are very welcoming and go out of their way to make sure you have a good time eating. AMAZING food, definitely would recommend the $2.50 margaritas. the nice blonde lady at the counter is always a joy to talk to and makes my experience that much better.

0edZ0qloqRyq9WEO9BFu6g.text: Love this place. In town for a bachelorette party & after 24 hours, I've been here twice. The chicken quesadilla has stewed chicken that is super moist & very well balanced with the cheese. Also has the spinach enchilada - yummy as well. Massive portions with free chips & fresh tasting salsa. The $2 margs aren't great but they're $2 so I didn't expect much. Can I bring this place back to NYC with me?!!

h1pVFyyNY-Mj0iYyxrGoQA.text: 2 may be too many stars.. had a chili that wasn't cooked, with greasy batter and unmelted cheese.  My dining partner had tacos that missed the mark... really soggy and dripping with grease, and not in a good way.  With so many great taco shops in a city that prides itself on Mexican food, drive right past Julio Too's..... save your money and your stomach for better food anywhere!

BzBbjdtNDAILwoLfhvJO3g.text: Ordered take out last night. I got chicken fajitas and a kids meal for my little one. They give you a bunch of chips and salsa to go and the food was amazing  can't wait to dine in sometime!

7HBVJ081vMKLW7GlTiP4ig.text: Who's Julio?    Well, whoever he is, he does good, simple, Mexican food. They have a full menu of Mexican fare and the price can't be beat for lunch. Bottled beer as well as margaritas are available. It is a nice touch for a limited service restaurant. The decor is a little out dated but not distracting. There is also a nice dining patio out front.   I stopped in for for lunch by myself (don't tell the Blonde) and ordered a taco salad. This came with a side of chips and salsa. The mild salsa was had well developed flavor with out being heavy on tomatoes. The house fried corn chips were light, crunchy and not greasy.    The taco salad shell was slightly over cooked and there were a few carrots in the salad mix. I suspect they are using a prepackaged salad mix. I ordered my taco salad with shredded beef. It was lightly seasoned letting the flavor of the slow cooked beef shine through. The taco salad was topped with a generous amount of sour cream and guacamole.     The staff was very helpful and courteous. They are attentive to the dining room and quickly replaced the Dr. Pepper when it ran out, delivered meals quickly and accurately, and offered to refill chips and salsa. Overall, a nice place for an quick inexpensive meal. They have plenty of off street parking, too.  Warm Fuzzies (the good stuff) -Clean inviting building. -Pleasant attentive staff -Generous portions. -Beer and Margaritas. -Off street parking (this is huge considering the location).  Cold Baldies (the not so good stuff) -Dated decor. -possibly too quiet (I don't remember any background music).

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

s2wAMt6S5dJduJ3KRkL13w.text: This place is great!  Couldn't believe the amount of food for the price.  The green chili pork was amazing and the fajita burrito was bomb.  Wish I lived closer so I could come more often.  I will probably be back in the morning for a breakfast burrito!

photos.caption: Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green chile pork!
Photo of Julio's Too - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fajita burrito

InbOOP7gbfx67FFeeDaMDA.text: Whether I'm in a hurry on lunch hour, or want to take my time - this is consistently my go to place for Mexican food. I'm a creature of habit and cannot bring myself to venture away from the excellent chicken tacos and chicken enchiladas. This is also one of the few places that I look forward to the rice and beans, as opposed to eating them because the main course is all gone. I love their salsa and chips as well. Finally, the staff is great every time I come in here.

_I2-csk-9lcRKW3UBJyksQ.text: This is literally the best Mexican food in Scottsdale I'm in love with this place I've had at least half the menu. The shredded beef tacos, tostadas, chimichangas, burritos, all of it is to die for! But the salsa is so fresh and amazing you can order half pints because you won't be able to stop eating it.
